greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of obtuse integer triangles with perimeter n and relatively prime side lengths.
example: For n=9 there are A005044(9)=3 integer triangles: [1,4,4], [2,3,4] and [3,3,3]; only one of them is obtuse: 2^2+3^2<16=4^2 and GCD(2,3,4)=1, therefore a(9)=1.
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 05 2002
